arm_group.description: Preoperative dexamethasone 8 mg (if body wight < 80 kilograms) or 12 mg (if body weight >/= 80 kilograms) mixed with NSS to 50 mL IV slowly push over 5 minutes
Preoperative intravenous normal saline 50 mL slowly push over 5 minutes

brief_summary.textblock:
To determine efficacy of preoperative IV dexamethasone for postoperative pain control after
      TKA.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of Preoperative Intravenous Dexamethasone in Primary Total Knee Arthroplasty

detailed_description.textblock:
Preoperative intravenous over 0.1 mg/kg of dexamethasone could be reduced pain after primary
      TKA.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Osteoarthritis of the knee who undergoing unilateral primary total knee arthroplasty

          -  50-85 years old

          -  ASA class 1-3

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Unable to perform spinal anaesthesia

          -  History of drug allergies: steroids

          -  Renal impairment (CrCl <30 mL/min)

          -  Liver impairment

          -  Cognitive function disorders

          -  Poor controlled DM (HA1C > 7.5)

          -  Morning DTX at operative day > 180 mg%

          -  Received corticosteroids within 3 months before surgery

intervention.description: Dexamethasone 8-12 mg mixed with NSS up to 50 mL IV slowly push over 5 minutes
NSS 50 mL IV slowly push over 5 minutes

facility.name: Orthopaedic department, Faculty of medicine, Thammasat university

clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Preoperative Intravenous Dexamethasone in Controlling Postoperative Pain After Primary Total Knee Arthroplasty: A Randomized Double-blinded Controlled Trial

other_outcome.description: measuring range of motion with goniometer

primary_outcome.description: measured with VAS for pain, drugs for relief pain

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: measured with amount of nausea/vomiting and drugs requiring for fixed its.
measured with wound complication, blood sugar level, WBC count
